news.title: Potential Trump tariff refund bill could top $1 trillion as Supreme Court fight looms
news.summary: The Supreme Court has not indicated when it might rule on a request by the Trump administration to rule quickly on whether many new tariffs are legal.

news.title: One year in, Brian Niccol’s Starbucks looks different — but there are still more changes coming
news.summary: Brian Niccol's turnaround strategy is bringing back some customers, but investors were expecting faster results. Niccol: "We have a lot of work to do, and we're going to do it."

news.title: Nebius shares soar 55% in premarket on Microsoft AI deal
news.summary: Nebius and Microsoft team up to train and run AI models. The move suggests demand for the powerful infrastructure needed to train AI models remains strong.

news.title: Shake Shack launches French onion soup items as it leans into premium promotions
news.summary: Shake Shack is following up its Dubai Chocolate Pistachio Shake with a French Onion Soup Burger. The burger is the latest in a series of Shake Shack products.

news.title: 'A colossal train wreck': U.S. energy chief slams odds of net zero by 2050
news.summary: Net zero by 2050 is "a monstrous human impoverishment program," U.S. energy secretary says. "There is no way it is going to happen," Chris Wright says.

news.title: I’m 70 and have $2.6 million for retirement. Is 80% in equities too risky?
news.summary: “We have been living primarily off my pensions, but plan on big family trips soon,” he said. “We’ve been living mainly off my pension, but we plan to go on bigFamily trips soon.”

news.title: MMA’s stock is skyrocketing — now that there’s a Trump connection
news.summary: Donald Trump Jr. is joining combat sports company MMA Inc. as a strategic advisor. He will work with the company on a range of strategic initiatives.

news.title: Another 1,000% gainer: CaliberCos surges on digital-asset purchase, a day after Eightco’s 3,000% gain
news.summary: Eightco Holdings’ stock surged 3,000% on the purchase of a digital asset. One analyst calls it “market madness.”

news.title: Fed is almost certain to cut rates by 25 basis points after months of debate. Why are so many people so unhappy about it?
news.summary: Economists are split into opposite camps on which is more important for the Fed to battle — slower growth or higher inflation. The Fed is expected to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade on Wednesday.

news.title: Why JPMorgan is warning the Fed rate cut everyone expects could sink stocks
news.summary: The widely expected September Fed rate cut may have a surprise in store for investors who think stocks have nowhere to go but up, warns JPMorgan.
